document.docAuthor: Kumar, Girish P. & Carpenter, James M.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic review of the genus Antodynerus de Saussure, 1855 (Hymenoptera: Vespidae: Eumeninae) from the Indian subcontinent

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic review of the genus Antodynerus de Saussure, 1855 (Hymenoptera: Vespidae: Eumeninae) from the Indian subcontinent

subSubSection.paragraph:
Rhygchium limbatum
de Saussure 1852 : 117
, ♀, pl. 13 fig. 10 , “L’Amerique? “ (coll. de Romand); 1875 : 143 (label wrong, incontestably Asiatic);
Dalla Torre 1894 : 46
(cat.; erroneously recorded from Madagascar );
Dalla Torre 1904 : 34
(cat.; erroneously recorded from Madagascar ).

Odynerus limbatus :
Bequaert 1918 : 290
(probably Asiatic);
Giordani Soika 1941 : 259
(in subgenus
Rhynchium
; syn.:
Rhynchium rugolatum Cameron
).

Odynerus haemorrhoidalis var. rugolatum :
Dover 1925 : 298
(in subgenus
Rynchium
).

Antodynerus limbatus :
Gusenleitner 1987 : 267
( Nepal ); 1988 : 180 ( Thailand ); 2006 : 690 ( India ); 2007 : 971 ( Pakistan ); 2011 : 1361 ( Laos ).

Diagnosis. Female . Clypeus with moderately deep punctures on middle; frons, ocular sinus, vertex and temple strongly punctured; area inside ocellar triangle smooth; median area of propodeum strongly concave, with a broadly elongate fovea from which median carina runs to orifice with few strong transverse striations posteriorly; postero-lateral margin almost entirely rounded with a strong transversely carinate projection, below that with strong transverse striations. T 1 1.67 × as wide as long, 0.88 × as wide as T 2 in dorsal view. Male. Clypeus with the apex between two teeth more deeply emarginate; genitalia as in
Fig. 18
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 7–12. 7, 8.
Antodynerus flavescens flavescens (Fabr.)
, ♂. 7. Metasomal segments with parasitic strepsipteran female; 8. Genitalia. 9–12.
A. limbatus (de Sauss.)
, ♀. 9. Body profile; 10. Head frontal view; 11. Head dorsal view; 12. Metasoma.

FIGURES 13–18.
Antodynerus limbatus (de Sauss.)
. 13. Female, metasomal segments with parasitic strepsipteran female. 14– 18. Male. 14. Head, frontal view; 15. Apical antennal segments; 16. Propodeum; 17. Lateral side of propodeum with symbiotic mites; 18. Genitalia.

Distribution. India (*Arunachal Pradesh, *Assam, *Delhi, *Himachal Pradesh, *Jammu & Kashmir, Kerala, *Manipur, Meghalaya, *Mizoram, *Nagaland, Rajasthan, Sikkim, *Tripura, Uttarakhand, West Bengal), * China (*Tibet), Laos , Myanmar , Nepal , Pakistan , Thailand .
